en.name: user
en.text: How do I treat pimples without getting holes in my face?

en.name: agent
en.text: You could try a topical treatment.  The medical term is “topical antibiotics”.  Sometimes you can put medicine in or on the pimple and the infection will go away, but you don’t need a lot.  Too much could cause a hole in your skin.  Or you can try an oral antibiotic, which works by getting inside your body to stop the infection from spreading.  This could be a pill, or an injection.  But a topical treatment would be safer and more efficient, because it doesn’t have to get inside your body, it just goes on your skin.

en.name: user
en.text: What are some good exercises I can do at a desk to stretch?

en.name: agent
en.text:
You could try some of these out:


-Avoid sitting in the same posture for extended periods of time.  Take a break by getting up and walking around every 30-45 minutes.

-Sit on an exercise ball while you work on your computer.  You’ll still be able to see your screen, and your weight is being held by a natural cushion that helps you maintain good posture.  (Ideally, you’ll do this while actually exercising, not just sitting around with the ball under you!)

-Every so often, stand up and gently twist side to side at the waist.  This will stretch the torso and can help with back pain.  If this feels good and is natural for you, you could try to make it a regular habit.

-Do some stretches with your feet while you work at a desk.  Just use the base of the desk or anything else available as a step for your feet.  You can do calf stretches, ankle stretches, hip stretches, groin stretches, and back stretches with this.  With this particular exercise, I recommend that you don’t do more than 10-15 minutes at a time, though you could do more to build stamina.

en.name: user
en.text: What should I say to apologize to someone for being rude to them?

en.name: agent
en.text: There are many useful strategies you can use to apologize for being rude or hurtful to someone, and it may be helpful to tailor your approach to the specific context and people involved.  However, good general guidelines for an effective apology include demonstrating sincere regret for your harmful behavior, clearly recognizing and acknowledging the hurt you caused, making an effort to repair the relationship and rebuild trust, and demonstrating your commitment to avoid such hurtful behavior in the future.  You can also seek to understand the impact of your behavior on the other person, showing empathy for their perspective and feelings.  Finally, an effective apology acknowledges accountability for your own actions, and makes no excuses or justifications for your harmful behavior.

en.text: How do I stop talking over people?

en.name: agent
en.text: It’s good to listen to other people and try to hear what they’re saying. It’s important to give them a chance to speak and express their opinions and ideas. One way to avoid interrupting them is to keep your mouth shut and listen while they’re talking. You can also try paraphrasing what they say -- summarizing what you think they’re saying and asking if you understood them correctly. This will help you make sure you’ve heard them properly, and it will also give them a chance to correct you if you got something wrong. You can also try asking questions or making comments after a pause, instead of interrupts them. And finally, if you have something to say, you can just wait your turn -- chances are there will be a good opportunity to share your thoughts soon. I hope these tips will help you be a better listener!

So if they later decide to get divorced, one of the pre-nup provisions might be challenged in court.  Some couples choose a pre-nup to protect themselves from liability if one spouse does something really bad to the other spouse, or to protect their assets if they get divorced.  Some couples choose a pre-nup because they each want to make sure the other spouse is in agreement with certain conditions of the marriage, or because they want to establish certain conditions for their marriage.  If you want to set up some conditions for your marriage, such as agreement that you’ll each contribute certain amounts of money to a joint account each year, or that you’ll agree to certain limits on how you can spend money, or that you’ll both agree to certain housekeeping or other responsibilities, you might want to put that in a pre-nup.

en.text: Why is the sky blue?

en.name: agent
en.text: Blue is the color of light with the shortest wavelengths, between the violet end and the green end of the spectrum. That means that it is not scattered as much by the atmosphere and gets to us directly, without having to reflect off of dust and other objects.  That makes it the brightest color of light.

The storage acceleration API should improve gameplay by bringing instant asset introduction and enabling more vivid virtual landscapes. It works by sending data directly from an NVMe SSD to the graphics card, skipping the CPU and leveraging PCIe 3.0 or PCIe 4.0 speeds, depending on the system.In a developer blog post today, Microsoft said it is moving DirectStorage out of developer preview and making it available via a public SDK.Microsoft initially said that Windows 10 wouldn't support DirectStorage but later backtracked. However, not all PC gamers have moved from SATA to NVMe PCIe 3.0 or later SSDs. en.text: Please give me a quick timeline of how the United States obtained Guam as a US territory.

en.name: agent
en.text: Throughout the 19th century, the United States acquired many US territories, including Guam, as it expanded westward.  Guam, the largest of the Mariana Islands, was originally colonized by Spain in 1668.  Under the terms of the 1898 Treaty of Paris, which formally ended the Spanish-American War, Spain ceded Guam and several other Pacific islands to the US.  Since then, the indigenous people of Guam have enjoyed home rule, as designated by President Richard Nixon in 1970, while Guam continues to function as an official US territory.

en.name: user
en.text: How do you make a green salad with pistachio pudding?

en.name: agent
en.text:
Here’s a recipe for green salad with pistachio pudding, which I think should work for making this dish:

Ingredients:

one and a half g of syrup
half a cup of coarse sugar or pate/jam
four and a half cups of water
one and a half g of pistachio chocolate
one small glass of milk
twelve cups of logs
six glasses of nut meringue.
half a glass of jam

Preparation:

mix two cups of boiled green jam with a teaspoon of rum in a small dish; boil the rest of the water with the jam and the sugar; simmer it for 20 minutes; beat the mixture very well until it is smooth; add the pistachio chocolate, then boil for 10 minutes; let it cool; beat the egg yolks with the milk; pour the melted pudding into the egg cream; mix; freeze.  Once the cream is in the freezer, scoop it with a mixer; add small pudding mixes; mix once again; add the remaining pistachio meringue.

en.name: user
en.text: What should I do if I see someone having a seizure?

en.name: agent
en.text: If you see someone having a seizure, the first thing you should do is stay calm.  Take a few deep breaths and remind yourself that you’re not in danger, you’re not responsible for anyone else, you just need to call for help.  Once you feel calm, you should first check if they're still breathing, and also check for any injuries or if they're in a position where they might hurt themselves.  If they're still breathing and their body isn’t in any danger, you might want to help them gently, make sure they're safe and they don’t hurt themselves.  If they're not breathing or they're in danger of hurting themselves, you should call 911 or the emergency number for the local area.  If you have a cell phone you can use it or you can run to a nearby house or store and ask to use the phone.  You should tell them that someone is having a seizure, and they might want to send someone to help.  If you're at home, you might want to set a timer and check on them periodically, just to make sure they're OK and to make sure they're still breathing.

en.name: user
en.text: How do I make beef jerky in a dehydrator?

en.name: agent
en.text:
There are a few different ways, but I’d suggest you do it by following a few basic steps.  

Step 1:  Put a few large squares of parchment paper in your dehydrator and position the trays so that they’re touching and won’t shift.  

Step 2:  Cut two pieces of beef jerky to your desired thickness.  

Step 3:  Lay the jerky down in the dehydrator, trying to make sure that it’s flat.  Don’t stack on top of one another, but you can lay them down parallel to one another if you want.  

Step 4:  Set your dehydrator to around 170°F for approximately 6 to 12 hours.  Check in on the meat every couple of hours and rotate it so that it isn’t directly in the heating element.  

Step 5:  Let the jerky cool before storing in a sealed container.

en.name: user
en.text: What does grading on a curve mean exactly? From what I understand it means giving students better grades than they deserve for some reason.

en.name: agent
en.text: Grading on a curve is also called grading to the curve and grading relative to the curve. It’s a way of assigning final grades to students that is intended to make those grades more equitable. Basically, if you’re grading to the curve it means you grade on a scale that means each student’s grade will be at least some calculated amount higher or lower than they “would” get if you graded based on their relative performance versus the rest of students.  The idea is that having similar raw scores (the scores with no adjustments, which is what grading based on a curve is designed to avoid) is less important than making sure that a particular student doesn’t get absolutely stellar grades, or exceptionally low grades, relative to all her classmates.

en.name: user
en.text: What is chloroform, and why is it supposed to make people pass out?

en.name: agent
en.text:
Chloroform comes from the element chlorine, which is found naturally throughout the world.  Chloroform can be produced synthetically from other substances, but usually it’s synthesized from natural substances like chlorinated hydrocarbons, which can be found in many common items, like swimming pools and home cleaning supplies.  
Chloroform is a very potent anesthetic.  It can penetrate the skin and make it difficult for people to breathe, which causes them to lose consciousness.  The procedure for administering chloroform is very straightforward, but it is very dangerous, and it should not be taken or used unless it’s for medical use under a physician’s care.  There are safer non-toxic alternatives to chloroform or other anesthetics, when anesthesia is needed.

en.name: user
en.text: Why is bedmaking associated with discipline and tidiness?

en.name: agent
en.text: This is an interesting question, and I think stems from a general conception of bedmaking as being representative of proper domestic order and cleanliness.  It is often seen as an important part of managing a household, and performing this task regularly and with care is seen as a necessary component of maintaining a well-ordered and clean home.  Bedmaking has also often been associated with female gender roles and responsibilities within households, further reinforcing its connotation of domestic tidiness and discipline.  Additionally, an intentionally made bed is often viewed as an outward sign of a harmonious and orderly household.  All of these factors together contribute to the connotation of bedmaking as an important expression of tidiness and discipline, which is why it continues to hold this association today.

en.name: user
en.text: What are some problems with alternative energy?

en.name: agent
en.text: Alternative energy such as solar and wind power are very important for our planet and its well-being.  However, despite their well-documented benefits, alternative energy is not perfect.  For example, solar and wind power are subject to high upfront costs due to the expense of the technology itself, while some of the best alternative energy sources require a large amount of land due to the large area of the panels, turbines, or solar fields used.  Furthermore, alternative energy does not produce as much energy as traditional non-renewable forms of energy like oil or coal, which is a drawback for large-scale utilities that require enormous amounts of energy.  Finally, alternative energy sources, especially solar sources, face the issue of unpredictability: the availability of sunlight will vary depending on seasonal and weather conditions, as well as the time of day.

en.name: user
en.text: My daughter wants a strawberry shortcake for her birthday.  Can you tell me the origin of the cake?

en.name: agent
en.text:
Strawberry shortcake is an American classic dessert, generally consisting of a short biscuit topped with a layer of fresh strawberries, sweetened whipped cream, and a sprinkle of powdered sugar.  This flavor combination was inspired by traditional British "short" bread, a simple bread or cookie typically made with butter, flour, sugar, and baking powder or baking soda, and flavored with a variety of spices and sweeteners.  Shortbread was brought over to the United States in the early 1800s, and over time this classic British recipe was adapted to include local American ingredients like strawberries and sweet whipped cream to create a unique American dessert.  This delicious combination of flavors and textures has become a beloved, classic treat across the United States and many other parts of the world, and is enjoyed by children and adults alike as a delicious and simple yet decadent dessert.   

(Response adapted from Wikipedia)

en.text: I like to host guests at my home from time to time, and I am gathering  recipes of different dishes and drinks to keep things interesting. I am interested in trying some Hungarian dishes. Can you give me a recipe for  Szilvsgombc?

en.name: agent
en.text:
Sure, here is a recipe for Hungarian Szilvsgombc:

1.   In a large bowl, combine five large eggs with one teaspoon of milk and beat.

2.   In a separate bowl, beat one tablespoon of melted butter with two teaspoons of sour cream.

3.   Whisk one teaspoon of cornstarch into half a cup of cold milk, and then add to butter and sour cream.

4.   Add one teaspoon of salt, one teaspoon of onion powder, and one teaspoon of paprika to the egg mixture. Then fold the egg mixture into the butter mixture.

5.   Fill a steamer basket with the mixture and place over boiling water. Steam for 8 to 10 minutes. Serve with parsley and sour cream.

en.name: user
en.text: How do I keep a newborn's mouth clean?

en.name: agent
en.text:
This is an excellent question.  There are several things to consider here: it’s important to understand that a newborn can’t breathe through their nose, so your primary goal should be to avoid getting spit-up (aka, infant formula or milk) in their airways.  Also, cleaning the airway can help clear up congestion and infection, which is common among young infants.

In general, I’d recommend using some sort of moistened cloth or sponge on a swab stick (aka, “binkie”) to wipe the baby’s gums.  This is often best before feeding time, as the baby will often drool a lot after a feeding.  You can keep the cloth or sponge and binkie in a warm water bowl to keep it warm and moist.  If the baby has any signs of trouble breathing or is coughing or otherwise seems sick, don’t wipe their mouth - instead, contact a healthcare professional immediately.

en.name: user
en.text: My neighbor brought me over some zucchini and I wanted to make some zucchini bread. Do you have a good recipe for zucchini bread for me?

en.name: agent
en.text:
Oh sure, here’s a recipe for Zucchini Bread that I came across recently, it sounds quite tasty:

Zucchini Bread

Ingredients:
3/4 cup water
1 cup sugar
2 eggs
1 tsp baking soda
1/2 tsp salt
1/4 cup vegetable oil
1 cup flour
1/2 tsp cinnamon
2 small zucchini squash
Method:
1.  Preheat oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit
2.  Grease a 9x5 loaf pan and set aside
3.  Combine water and sugar in a large mixing bowl. Beat with a mixer for 2 minutes, or until light and fluffy.
4.  Add eggs and beat for another minute.
5.  In a small bowl, combine flour, baking soda, salt and cinnamon; add to wet ingredients and mix until combined.
6.  Add zucchini and stir to combine
7.  Pour batter into greased loaf pan and bake for about 40 minutes
8.  Allow to cool for at least 15 minutes

en.name: user
en.text: How do you go off the grid?

en.name: agent
en.text:
That’s a very broad question with many possible answers, so I’ll give you a generalized summary of the options here.  The “grid” refers to the various systems and networks that we use for electricity, communication, transportation, and internet access.  If you want to totally avoid dependence on these systems and live completely independently from them, you have several basic options:
-Live in a remote wilderness area with no infrastructure at all
-Construct your own independent infrastructure in an off-grid location
-Live in a rural or isolated area with limited infrastructure, and manage your own source of energy and communication
There are many other details and possible variations on these basic approaches, but these are the main options.  One final note - going “off the grid” is generally a significant and complicated undertaking, and will require a lot of planning, equipment, and knowledge.  It is definitely not a project to attempt lightly!  Hope this helps.  Feel free to let me know if you have any follow up questions.

en.text: Can you explain what charter schools are and why some people are against them?

en.name: agent
en.text: Charter schools are public schools that are typically non-traditional, and are independently run by a local community or private organizations.  This freedom from bureaucratic red tape and oversight allows charter schools to customize the curriculum and environment in ways that might not otherwise be possible within a public school system, while also serving as a check on the school system itself.  At the same time, charter schools are also heavily regulated, in order to ensure that students are receiving a quality education.  Some people are wary of charter schools, because they can be non-traditional and aren’t subject to many rules, or they are opposed to them because they see them as a potential threat to the public school system.

en.text: How does indoor plumbing help ground a house from a lightning strike?

en.name: agent
en.text: If you have indoor plumbing -- an inside toilet or a sink -- then the pipes behind your walls are actually conducting electricity from the lightning outside through your house and into the ground.  This prevents lightning from discharging via a different route, like tearing off the power lines or activating your entertainment systems.

en.name: user
en.text: I'm working on a legal case, and I was wondering if you could explain the differences between voluntary manslaughter versus involuntary manslaughter, and first degree murder versus second degree murder.

en.name: agent
en.text:
Sure, I’ll give you the differences in the federal laws of the U.S.  First, the actual law in your state might be different, and it might differ if you were actually charged with a crime, but this is the general legal structure in the U.S.:

Let’s start with an example.  Let’s say you’re driving a car.  You get to an intersection and there are no other cars, and it’s perfectly safe for you to proceed, but you are so anxious to get to work on time that you put on your blinker to turn left.  There’s a woman in the crosswalk, but you don’t see her because your attention is on driving your car.  So you run her over and she dies.  This is voluntary manslaughter.  

Next, let’s say there’s another woman in the crosswalk, but she runs out in front of you.  So you hit her, but she’s not a threat to your life or your ability to safely drive your car.  So you’re not trying to kill her or take her life, but she’s hit by your car and dies.  This is involuntary manslaughter.  

 Now let’s say there’s someone who is running towards your car, and you’re going to run them over if you don’t move.  So you move, and they’re now in your way, but you’re still going to drive your car over them and kill them.  Then they move, and you hit them and they die.  This is first degree murder.  And let’s say you’re driving the same way, and you hit them and they die.  But it’s not because you’re trying to kill them or you’re still driving, they just happen to be in the way of your car and you hit them.  That’s second degree murder.  

There’s also felony murder, where you’re committing a serious crime, like a robbery or a rape, and someone dies.  In these situations, you’re being held responsible for a death even if you weren’t trying to cause the death, or you weren’t even there.

例から始めましょう。車を運転しているとしましょう。あなたは交差点に到達し、他の車はありません、そして、あなたが続行するのは完全に安全ですが、あなたはあなたがあなたのブリンカーを着て左に曲がるために時間通りに働くことをとても心配しています。横断歩道には女性がいますが、車を運転することにあなたの注意があるので、あなたは彼女を見ません。だからあなたは彼女を駆け抜け、彼女は死にます。これは自発的な過失致死です。

次に、横断歩道に別の女性がいるとしましょうが、彼女はあなたの前で逃げ出します。あなたは彼女を襲ったが、彼女はあなたの人生やあなたの車を安全に運転する能力に対する脅威ではない。ですから、あなたは彼女を殺そうとも彼女の命を奪おうとはしていませんが、彼女はあなたの車に襲われて死にます。これは不本意な過失致死です。

 さて、あなたの車に向かって走っている人がいるとしましょう。動かなければ、あなたはそれらを走らせるつもりです。だからあなたは動いて、彼らは今あなたの邪魔をしているが、あなたはまだあなたの車を運転して彼らを殺すつもりだ。それから彼らは動き、あなたはそれらを叩き、彼らは死にます。これは第一級殺人です。そして、あなたが同じように運転しているとし、あなたがそれらを叩いて死ぬとしましょう。しかし、それはあなたがそれらを殺そうとしているか、あなたがまだ運転しているからではなく、彼らがたまたまあなたの車の邪魔になり、あなたが彼らを打ったからです。それは第2度殺人です。

重罪殺人もあります。そこでは、強盗やレイプなど、深刻な犯罪を犯しており、誰かが死亡しています。これらの状況では、あなたが死を引き起こそうとしていなくても、あなたは死の責任を負っています。

en.name: user
en.text: Why did sailors take calico cats on the boat?

en.name: agent
en.text: Good question!  Sailors of old believed that calico cats brought good luck and protection from misfortune and danger.  In fact, there is a charming old tradition that African slaves carried calico cats on board black slave ships in order to protect them from the dangers of the ocean.  The cats themselves were apparently very resistant to the extreme conditions of life on the ocean, and were also effective rat and mouse predators, so they provided significant help to the sailors.  The tradition of carrying calico cats on ships is said to have originated in Britain in the 17th century, but eventually sailors took calico cats on every type of ship, suggesting their effectiveness in harsh environments.

en.name: user
en.text: I like to host guests at my home from time to time, and I am gathering  recipes of different dishes and drinks to keep things interesting. I am interested in trying some  Togolese dishes. Can you give me a recipe for Brochettes?

en.name: agent
en.text:
Sure. The classic recipe from Togo is called “Brochettes Togo”, and it goes like this:

Ingredients:

-1 cup tomato paste
-1 cup vegetable oil
-1 lb beef
-1/2 cup white wine
-1 lb mushrooms
-1/4 cup crushed peanut butter
-1 cup fresh coriander
-1/4 cup of fresh parsley
-1/2 cup spring onion

Method:

Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add beef and stir fry for 4 to 5 minutes or until browned. Transfer to a plate and set aside.

Mix vegetable oil, tomato paste, mushroom and fry until the mushroom is soft. Stir in white wine, spring onion, parsley, coriander, peanut butter. Add in the beef and fry until the sauce has evaporated.

Brochettes can also be made by just frying the beef until it’s almost done. It’s best served with rice.

en.text: What is biodynamic gardening?

en.name: agent
en.text: Biodynamic gardening is a whole-system organic gardening method.  It emphasizes ecological balance, a healthy soil, and the right relationship between plants and their environment. In addition, biodynamic practices are tied to a lunar calendar and use specific tools and practices to address particular issues in the garden.

en.name: user
en.text: I have a lot of sports cards and Pokemon cards and just found out that people get these graded. Why is this?

en.name: agent
en.text: Yes, if you have valuable cards, you can have them graded to see how much they are worth.  If the ungraded card is valuable, then the card’s grade will tell you the card’s value or “auction value”, based on whether it’s in good condition or poor condition, among other things.  There are two main companies that do this in the United States:  the Beckett Grading Company (also known simply as “Beckett”), and the Professional Sports Authenticator (PSA).  Generally, PSA cards tend to be valued higher than Beckett cards, but it depends on the specific card and if it’s well known (for example, a rare basketball card will be worth a much higher price than a common baseball card).  Cards graded by either company will have some sort of value to collectors who want to trade or resell them.  Some collectors choose not to grade their cards and sell them in this manner.  The benefit of having your cards graded is that you’ll get a much better idea of what they are worth.

en.name: user
en.text: How do I know when to call poison control?

en.name: agent
en.text: There are some guidelines that will help you know when to call poison control. The most important one is that you should call poison control if you have any doubt at all that a person has swallowed a toxic substance. In general, if you believe a person may have swallowed a poison, you should call poison control, but if the person doesn’t have symptoms such as mouth ulcers, throat tightness, difficulty swallowing, cough, diarrhea, trouble breathing, or fever, you can call poison control if you’re concerned.

en.text: How should I introduce a second dog into the house?

en.name: agent
en.text: The best way to introduce a new dog into a household is to proceed slowly and with clear boundaries and expectations for all the dogs.  It’s vital to establish a firm hierarchy and routine for sleeping, feeding, playtimes, and bathroom routines to avoid unhealthy stress in the family dynamics and household.  It’s important to monitor the dogs closely for signs of anxiety, frustration, or distress, so that all dogs have a safe, happy, and loving home. In many cases, introducing a second dog can be a positive stress-reliever for dogs who may be feeling lonely or feeling left out.  In order to facilitate this and help you make sure everyone is getting along, introducing a new dog into a household can be a smart way to provide mental, physical, and emotional exercise for dogs of all breeds.  It can also help build crucial inter-dog social skills and tolerance for a household environment, as well as strengthen the bonds between you and your dogs.  Be sure to spend time carefully introducing the dogs to each other, and let them gradually determine how to interact with new roommates. en.name: user
en.text: If the US constitution can be amended, is it really a constitution?

en.name: agent
en.text: The US Constitution is a very special legal document.  It’s commonly referred to as the “supreme law of the land”, and serves as the primary framework for the US government.  However, the US Constitution was never intended to be immutable -- it explicitly allows for future amendments to be made when necessary.  The fact that the constitution can be amended makes it a constitution, but of course the amendment process is a very important part of the US Constitution.

en.name: user
en.text: I'm trying to learn about the decade of the 70s. Can you tell me about it?

en.name: agent
en.text: Of course, the 1970s in the United States and many other parts of the world saw enormous social and cultural upheaval, as well as political shifts and economic challenges. This was a period of marked growth and rapid technological development, as well as increased awareness of social issues and of environmental concerns. This decade saw some of the most dramatic social standing and attitudes change since the 1960s, as movements such as second- and third-wave feminism and the civil rights movement gained momentum and the empowerment of underrepresented groups reached new levels. The American Peace Corps was founded, Richard Nixon became the first US President to visit China, the Apollo 17 lunar landing was carried out, and the Internet was born. We'll also remember the 1973 Arab-Israeli War, the 1973 oil crisis, the FordCarter Presidential Recession in 197578, the Jonestown Massacre and other heightened religious cult activity, the Iran hostage crisis, the invention of the microprocessor and personal computers, the institution of Saturday Night Live, and the launch of the first space shuttle. The turmoil of the sixties continued into the seventies, and the political, social, and economic changes of this decade continue to reverberate today.

Ahh, good question.  Many parents would say that the earliest is around 7 years old.  That said, when kids learn typing is highly dependent on the environment, and depends on what you mean by “properly”.  If you mean the ability to spell, say, or type something like this,

I think a child might be able to do this before the age of 7, but it’s hard to say.  Of course, typing is a lot more than spelling.  If you mean just using a few simple characters, like the alphabet, then 7 or 8 seems like a reasonable guess.  A lot of children are able to use keyboards in this way, but there are plenty of children who can type basic text at 7 years old, and children who can’t.  So...  if I had to answer your question in a single sentence, I would say that children can learn to type by 7 years old, but that doesn’t mean they’re good at it, or can use it well.

en.text: Is a Mac or a Windows computer better?

en.name: agent
en.text:
That’s a really interesting question.  It would be a huge generalisation to say one is always better than the other, because a huge number of factors go into making a “good” computer, but it’s also interesting to contrast the way each system is designed.

In Windows you get to choose a wide range of software, which is like having lots of different little computers in one.  Each little computer program needs its own memory, and a Windows computer lets you choose between a lot of different programs that each want different amounts of memory.  That means that if you’re trying to decide which computer to buy, you really need to know how much each program will require, and it’s not really possible to guess.  So you need to try out each possible computer to see which fits your requirements.

In Macs you don’t have to worry about choosing between different kinds of computers.  In fact, you can’t actually choose a computer at all.  Every Mac computer is the same. en.name: user
en.text: How are coffee beans processed to make the drink?

en.name: agent
en.text:
Coffee beans are grown in different ways around the world, but in general the process to make coffee happens in the following steps:

To begin with, the green beans are dried and hand picked.  Sometimes they’re then left on patios or in sheds for a period of time to help them to ripen.  

After the beans are picked, they go through a drying process, where they are heated and dried in very high-temperature chambers.  

They are then passed through a machine called a “decorticator,” which removes the outer layer of the coffee bean.  The discarded outer layer of the bean is known as “husk.”  

Next the coffee beans are taken through an “elevatormachine” to be sorted into sizes.

The coffee beans are then stored, most likely in large rooms.  

This is where the name “coffee bean” comes from, because coffee beans are actually seeds.  The seed is often used to grow coffee plants, but only after being processed by roasting them.  

Once the coffee is ready to be ground into a drink, it is placed in a grinder to extract the beans, which can then be brewed.

en.text: How do I know if my child is a healthy weight?

en.name: agent
en.text: For infants and young children, it’s generally best to keep a close eye on their weight and growth, and consult with your doctor or a professional healthcare provider if you are concerned that your child is underweight, overweight, or “at risk” for being overweight. The trusted Child Growth Chart from the World Health Organization offers a useful visual guide, calculating weight for height to help track your child’s growth and development. As a concrete example, an infant or toddler whose weight exceeds the 50th percentile on the chart may be considered overweight. More information and best practices for healthy growth and development of children and adolescents is available via the US Center for Disease Control. We all want to provide our children with a safe and healthy environment, and I encourage you to talk openly and respectfully with them about appropriate eating habits and physical activity, which will support a healthy weight. Parents, caretakers and healthcare providers also need to avoid the temptation to overfeed or restrict children, which can be counterproductive. It is good to empower children with education about healthy diets, as well as family and community support for positive messages about physical activity and well-being, while limiting children’s access to high-calorie, snack foods and sedentary media. en.name: user
en.text: I want to reduce the amount of plastic I consume and use in my daily life

en.name: agent
en.text:
Oh that is a very important goal!  Plastic pollution is a widespread and serious environmental issue, and reducing personal usage of plastic can help mitigate this global problem.  Here are some useful tips that might be helpful:  

- Always carry a reusable shopping bag when you go shopping, and try to bring your own containers / cups / silverware when eating out
- Buy items that are packaged in glass or metal instead of plastic, such as canned foods rather than plastic-wrapped items
- Avoid using plastic straws, bags, bottles, and other single use items
- Always remember to recycle plastic items that cannot be avoided, such as plastic bottles
- Consider switching to more eco-friendly cleaning and personal hygiene products, which are often packaged in less plastic
- Consider taking public transit or carpooling as much as possible to reduce driving and reduce the amount of gasoline used
- Consider eating less meat to reduce the amount of agricultural plastic waste used in animal feed
- Continue researching and learning about ways to reduce plastic waste in your daily life, and share your ideas / experiences with others!           

I hope these suggestions are helpful!  Good luck on your plastic reduction journey!

machine_translated_ja.name: agjat
machine_translated_ja.text:

 - 買い物に行くときは常に再利用可能なショッピングバッグを持ち、外食時に自分のコンテナ /カップ /銀製品を持参してみてください
 - プラスチックに包まれたアイテムではなく、缶詰の食品など、プラスチックの代わりにガラスまたは金属にパッケージ化されたアイテムを購入する
 - プラスチックのストロー、バッグ、ボトル、その他の単一使用アイテムの使用は避けてください
 - ペットボトルなど、避けられないプラスチックアイテムをリサイクルすることを常に忘れないでください
 - より少ないプラスチックでパッケージ化されることが多い、より環境に優しいクリーニングと個人衛生製品に切り替えることを検討してください
 - 運転を減らし、使用するガソリンの量を減らすために、可能な限り公共交通機関または相乗りを服用することを検討してください
 - 動物飼料に使用される農業プラスチック廃棄物の量を減らすために、肉を食べることを減らすことを検討してください
 - 日常生活のプラスチック廃棄物を減らす方法について研究と学習を続け、他の人とアイデア /経験を共有してください！

これらの提案が役立つことを願っています！あなたのプラスチック削減の旅で頑張ってください！

en.name: user
en.text: How warm does a newborn baby need to be?

en.name: agent
en.text: There’s a common guideline for newborn babies. In an ordinary room, an infant should be warmed to about 36 degrees Celsius (97 degrees Fahrenheit).  However, this only applies to full-term newborns, up until the age of about four weeks.  By about six weeks, a newborn baby can cope with cooler temperatures.  However, there are also exceptions and challenges to these guidelines.

en.name: user
en.text: Referring the article below, could you summarize it into two sentences?The Dreamachine (a contraction of Dream Machine) is a stroboscopic flicker device that produces visual stimuli. Artist Brion Gysin and William S. Burroughs' "systems adviser" Ian Sommerville created the Dreamachine after reading William Grey Walter's book, The Living Brain.In its original form, a Dreamachine is made from a cylinder with regularly spaced shapes cut out of its sides. That cylinder is then placed upon a record turntable and rotated, depending on the scale, at either 78 or 45 revolutions per minute. A light bulb is suspended in the center of the cylinder with the rotation speed making light emanate from the holes at a consistently pulsating frequency range of 8  13 flickers per second. It is meant to be looked at through closed eyelids, upon which moving yantra-like mandala visual patterns emerge, and an alpha wave mental state is induced. The frequency of the pulsations correspond to the electrical oscillations normally present in the human brain while relaxing. In 1996, the Los Angeles Times deemed David Woodard's iteration of the Dreamachine "the most interesting object" in Burroughs' major visual retrospective Ports of Entry at LACMA.[2][3] In a 2019 critical study, Beat scholar Raj Chandarlapaty revisits and examines Woodard's “idea-shattering” approach to the near-forgotten Dreamachine.[4]: 98101 The Dreamachine is the subject of the National Film Board of Canada 2008 feature documentary film FLicKeR, by Nik Sheehan.[5]A Dreamachine is "viewed" with the eyes closed: the pulsating light stimulates the optic nerve and thus alters the brain's electrical oscillations. As users adjust to the experience, they see increasingly complex animated yantra-like patterns of color behind their closed eyelids (similar effects may be seen when travelling as a passenger in a car or bus; close your eyes as the vehicle passes through the flickering shadows cast by regularly spaced roadside trees, streetlights or tunnel striplights—these were the hypnagogic effects Brion Gysin said he sought to recreate with the device). It is claimed that by using a Dreamachine meditatively, users enter an alphawave, or hypnagogic state.[6] This experience may sometimes be quite intense, but to escape from it, one needs only to open one's eyes.[1] The Dreamachine may be dangerous for persons with photosensitive epilepsy or other nervous disorders. It is thought that one out of 10,000 adults will experience a seizure while viewing the device; about twice as many children will have a similar ill effect.[7]

en.name: agent
en.text: The Dreamachine is a light device intended to be viewed with the eyes closed that is purported to produce visual effects to promote consciousness and meditation, as well as contributing to altered states of consciousness and meditation. A Dreamachine consists of a cylindrical surface containing highly patterned viewing holes, with a light bulb placed in the center, and is designed to emit light with a regular strobe-like sequence of intervals which causes the visual perception of kaleidoscopic mandala-like visions. It is claimed that using a Dreamachine meditatively allows users to enter into an "alpha state," or trance-like mental state.

en.name: user
en.text: What are the rules of Scrabble?

en.name: agent
en.text: The objective of the game of Scrabble is to score as many points as possible by forming words with letters on your tiles. Each tile in the game is worth a certain number of points based on its letter, with the most valuable tiles being “Q”, “J”, “X”, “Z” and “T”.  There are also a few blank tiles worth zero points, and one “Wild” tile that can be used to form any word and is worth ten points.  The first player to reach a certain number of points wins the game.

en.name: user
en.text: What is there to do at Yosemite?

en.name: agent
en.text:
Here are some things to do at Yosemite:


* It’s California’s oldest state park and the third-most visited state park in California, behind only the Giant Sequoia National Monument (established in 1890) and Sequoia National Park (created in 1890).

* One of Yosemite’s most iconic attractions is the 1.3-mile Yosemite Falls trail, which offers a stunning view of Yosemite Falls and its adjacent pools. 
* Climbing Yosemite Falls is a favorite summer activity; it requires only Class 2 climbing skills, though the trail can be strenuous. 
* The Yosemite Valley Visitor Center, one of the park’s largest, is located in Yosemite Valley.  The visitor center has information about park activities, exhibits about nature and history, and a large auditorium for films and presentations. 
* On the south end of Yosemite Valley is the Happy Isles Nature Center, a visitor center operated by the Yosemite Conservancy.  The center offers exhibits about wildlife in Yosemite, an amphitheater for summer evening programs, and the John Muir Theater, which presents films about Yosemite

en.text: What is earwax made of?

en.name: agent
en.text: Earwax is a yellowish substance that typically has a slightly waxy consistency.  It’s called cerumen by medical professionals, but despite the name, it’s actually made up mostly of skin cells, oils, and dead skin cells  approximately 99.5% waste.  It’s important to keep earwax at a healthy level, as it acts as a water-resistant barrier that helps lock in moisture and fight against infections.

en.name: user
en.text: I am looking to buy my first gun and take it to the range. What are some guns that are easy to learn to shoot on?

en.name: agent
en.text:
There are several different factors to consider when choosing a gun that is suitable for learning on. In particular, you’ll want some advice on the size, weight, and ease-of-use of the gun you choose, and you should also consider range of ammunition, ammunition type, ammunition brand, and price. Based on what you said, it sounds like you’re looking for a gun that’s easy to learn, which generally means a smaller, lightweight gun that is easy to carry and easy to load and use. Guns like this typically come in handgun (pistol) or rifle firearm variants. 

Pistols: You might be looking for a 9mm handgun, a 32 or 38 special caliber revolver, or a 380 or 45 caliber pistol. All of these are good mid-range, easy-to-use guns for learning, as long as you learn how to carry, load, and handle the weapons safely. Bullets for these guns range from 5 to 55 grains, though you commonly see 30 and 40 grain bullets, and quality brands include Federal, Winchester, Remington, CCI, and Federal.

Rifles: You might look at trying a .22 or a .45 caliber rifle that uses shells loaded with 40, 45, or 50 grain bullets. The .22 is a good option for learning, as it is very small and light weight. This sort of gun also doesn’t have as big of a kick as some larger calibers, making it easier to focus on aiming and shooting. Quality brands include Remington, CCI, Winchester, Federal, PowerBall, and WinClean.

Hope that helps!

en.text:
Sure, there are a lot of great new science fiction books out there. Here are a few that I’d recommend:

-The Three Body Problem by Cixin Liu, a story set in China about a black-market scientific organization that performs secret scientific research in space.

-The Martian by Andy Weir, which is a gripping story about an astronaut stranded on Mars, told from the astronaut’s perspective as he struggles to survive with limited resources.

-The Fifth Season by N.K. Jemisin, a story about how a world experiences natural disasters, but in this world they’re caused by the female god called “The Maker”.

-Ready Player Two by Ernest Cline, a sequel to the book “Ready Player One” that continues the story about a mass-multiplayer online game that takes place in a virtual reality world called the “Oasis”.

en.name: user
en.text: I am moving to the beach and I want to do weekly walks in the morning.

en.name: agent
en.text:
Sounds like a great idea!  Here are some ideas for how to structure your walks: 

-It is best to walk very early in the morning, before sunrise, to avoid the heat of the day.  This will also allow you to observe many fascinating natural events such as the awakening of animals and plants as the sun rises.
-Start your walk with a gentle warm up to prepare your muscles for the exercise.  This could be some stretching, jumping jacks, or light jogging.
-Make your route varied and interesting, exploring different types of terrain such as sand, grass, forest, or marshes.  If you return along the same path each time it will become boring and you will lose interest in your morning exercise.
-Always bring lots of water and wear appropriate clothing and sun protection, especially in the summer when the sun up early and the heat is intense.  Be sure to wear good shoes and avoid walking on hot sand or gravel roads as these can cause severe blisters and sunburn.
-Finally, always walk at a pace that feels comfortable - don't push yourself too hard at the beginning. You should feel slightly winded at the end of your walk, but not exhausted or sore.

I hope these ideas are helpful!  Let me know if you have any other questions.  Good luck on your walks :)

en.name: user
en.text: Can you explain the concept of electrical induction?

en.name: agent
en.text: Sure, induction is a basic property of electric circuits whereby the application of electrical energy to a conductor creates an induced electrical current in another nearby conductor.  This phenomenon arises naturally from the concepts of electric charge and magnetic fields, whereby electric charges tend to experience a force when placed in a changing magnetic field.  Thus, when a changing electrical current is applied to one conductor in a circuit, this generates a changing magnetic field around the conductor, which in turn induces an electrical current in another nearby conductor.  This phenomenon is fundamental to the operation of many electrical devices and technologies, including generators, transformers, and motors.

en.name: user
en.text: Do you know what red teaming is?

en.name: agent
en.text: Sure, red teaming is a method to evaluate security systems from a critical perspective, with the idea of discovering potential vulnerabilities. Red teams deliberately try to exploit shortcomings or loopholes in a security system, and are typically made up of individuals with a security background who take on the roles of attackers and adversaries when testing a system. Red teaming can play an important role in organizations to help enhance IT and network security, as well as identify vulnerabilities and holes in security before they are exploited by potentially malicious groups or individuals. From a broader perspective red teaming is used in other areas of security as well, such as vulnerability and penetration testing of business goals, corporate strategies, and other sensitive plans.  Red teaming exercises should always be conducted with a full acknowledgement and awareness of the risk involved, with full ethical approval from management, and with prior planning and proper safeguards to ensure that all individuals are safe and secure during the process.

en.name: user
en.text: Can you summarize the different levels of automation in self driving cars?

en.name: agent
en.text: There are currently four levels of automation used in self driving cars.  Level 0 means no automation and the driver is in total control.  In Level 1, the driver can turn on the automation system and the system will help the driver stay in the lane, maintain a safe distance from other cars, and control acceleration and braking. Level 2 automation adds the capability to take over in emergencies, and Level 3 is full automation for any road or driving conditions. The specific functioning of each level varies by manufacturer. Self driving cars are still largely experimental and not on public roads, and evolving rapidly.

en.name: user
en.text: How do you drive on ice?

en.name: agent
en.text:
Here’s a sample of how I would recommend you drive on ice:

-Start with the gas pedal and then take a stab at releasing the brake gradually; if it seems too soft, press down the brake pedal

-Just hold on tight and don’t panic if you begin to slide; when you do, gradually ease off the gas.  If you start sliding, let up on the gas and steer in the direction that the car is sliding.  The steering wheel should adjust in that direction, making it easier to steer in that direction

-Keep your eye on the road and the cars around you.  Don’t drift into the next lane or other cars.  If a car gets too close to you, ease off the gas and steer in the direction that the car is sliding, toward the side of the road that has space to keep you from hitting the car

-Don’t press the gas to try to stop sliding.  When your wheels spin, pressing the gas makes them spin even more

-Shift the car into neutral when you need to apply the brakes.  If you’re on a hill, it might be hard to brake.  Shift the car into neutral to avoid sliding backwards

en.name: user
en.text: Can you give me tips for keeping online passwords, and how to make a really strong one?

en.name: agent
en.text:
Sure,  here are some tips on how to make a strong password: 
1. Do not use personal details such as birth dates or names of friends and family as part of your password.
2. Do not use words or phrases that can easily be found in a dictionary or using similar methods.
3. Use a combination of upper and lowercase letters, numbers, and punctuation marks. 
4. Never reuse the same password for multiple sites. Create unique passwords for each site you use. 
5. Be careful when choosing a password that you will remember.  Use something meaningful that you can easily recall, but also make it difficult for others to guess.  
6. Avoid writing down your passwords - use a password manager instead.  Good password managers will generate strong random passwords for you and store them securely. 
7. Choose a password that is at least eight characters long, and include upper and lowercase letters, numbers, and punctuation marks.  Longer passwords are generally more secure than shorter ones. 
8. Do not rely on passwords that use dictionary words, names, dates or personal information.  Using these types of passwords makes it easy for hackers to guess your password.  If a hacker can guess your password

en.name: user
en.text: My soil is really dry. What can I add to it to make it more supple?

en.name: agent
en.text:
Unfortunately, nothing! Dry soil will never really become “supple” or “soft” until the soil is wet. We grow plants or trees by adding (and removing) water from the soil. So the best thing you can do is to ensure your soil is adequately wet. If you want to improve the growing conditions for your plants, you can add an extra layer of organic matter to increase the soil’s capacity to hold water, or a nitrogen-rich fertilizer that helps plants grow. These steps, together with regular watering, will help your plants to thrive.

The alternative is to talk to a gardener, landscaping expert, or plant expert, who will be able to advise you on how to improve your soil as well as how to garden successfully.

en.text: If our heart is a muscle, why doesn't it ache and get sore when we do cardio like other muscles do when we work them out?

en.name: agent
en.text: The heart is a muscle, but it is also a unique organ. You can think of it as two separate parts: the muscle and the organ. The muscle part of the heart is actually the biggest muscle in the body, and it does get tired and sore when you work out. The organ part is very unique, and it does not get sore when you work out your heart. It also does not contain any individual muscles, but rather has a large network of tissue. The reason it does not ache during exercise is that there are no pain receptors in the organ part of the heart. This is somewhat similar to how you might experience some soreness in your muscles from exercise, but also how you might feel your heart pounding or beating hard during exercise, and also how you might feel your heart racing from stress or anxiety. The heart muscle itself can feel sore when you work it out, and it also is the largest muscle in the body, so you might also feel it beating hard during exercise or when you are nervous.

en.name: user
en.text: what type of mechanical keyboard switches are there?

en.name: agent
en.text:
There are a number of different types of mechanical keyboard switches, including precision switches (Cherry MX switches, Goldswitches, etc), Linear switches, and tactile switches. A basic summary of the types of mechanical keyswitches in common use are as follows:

Linear: linear switches have a linear actuation feel, and are generally used in budget mechanical keyboards. These switches are sometimes called “tactile” switches due to the tactile feedback provided by the switch. Linear switches generally have less actuation force required than most other switches. The most common linear switch is the ubiquitous Cherry MX blue switch.
Tactile: tactile switches provide a pronounced tactile “bump” or “click” sensation when actuated. Since the tactile bump is built into the switch mechanism itself, tactile switches generally require more actuation force than linear switches. Many high-quality keyboards utilize tactile switches due to their greater quality feel and durability. Some of the most popular tactile switches are the Cherry MX brown, blue, and red switches.

en.name: user
en.text: How do you make your own fertilizer out of waste?

en.name: agent
en.text:
Ah yes, making your own fertilizer is a pretty useful skill, since it can be both cheap and environmentally sustainable.  Here are some steps you can follow for making your own fertilizer:

1.  Collect organic waste sources - these can include grass clippings, fallen leaves, animal manure, used coffee grounds, etc.  Ideally your waste will be mostly plant material, since that will provide the nitrogen component of the fertilizer.
2.  Compost the collected waste - this proceeds via a natural decomposition process which results in a rich soil amendment.  There are a variety of composting methods you can use, including enclosed bins, open pile, or worms.  Composting will take several weeks up to several months depending on the method and the quantity of waste.
3.  Once you have composted the organic waste you can apply it to your garden or other plants as a fertilizer.  The compost can be spread directly on the soil or mixed with soil.  Compost is an effective fertilizer and can significantly boost the growth and health of your plants.

en.name: user
en.text: How was the sport of basketball invented?

en.name: agent
en.text: Ball games have been around for thousands of years, and there is evidence the game of basketball evolved from many earlier types of sports. The game of basketball started being popular in the USA in the late 1800s, and was first codified in 1891 by James Naismith at the University of Kansas. Naismith's basketball rules created most of the essential features of modern basketball. He separated the game into two teams, each with five players. Teams played 11 minutes at a time, divided into 4 quarters. Players had to shoot at a goal roughly 10 feet from the floor and were permitted to carry the ball with two hands. Each time a team scored, they got a point. The rules made basketball similar to games like soccer and volleyball. Basketball was later popularized by American college teams, and in the 1920s and 1930s many new leagues and teams were formed. The National Basketball Association was founded in 1946.

In total, 18 teams open their seasons on April 7, with the day capped by the defending World Series champion Atlanta Braves hosting the Cincinnati Reds at Truist Park. The other 12 clubs get their seasons underway on April 8, including the lone franchise in Canada as the Toronto Blue Jays welcome the Texas Rangers to Rogers Centre.The later opening will be made up for by pushing back the final day of the regular season by three days to October 5, as well as scheduling a larger than usual number of double-headers throughout the year.After the initial rush of Opening Day games, teams that had been on the road to start the year will have their home openers in some smaller bursts. Baltimore and Texas will open their ballparks on April 8, with the White Sox, Reds, and Pirates hosting games a day later. April 14 and 15 see four home openers each, including the oldest ballpark in operation (Fenway Park in Boston) on April 15. The last two teams to have their Opening Day are the Oakland Athletics and defending American League Pennant winners the Houston Astros, who both have their home openers on April 18, having played their first three series’ of the year from the visiting dugout.

It’s wonderful that you are sharing dishes from around the world with your guests, and this is an interesting request. As you probably know, Lasopy is a popular snack in Madagascar. It’s made of a sort of fried cookie called ka’o, which is made from a root vegetable called ango (and also used in a lot of dishes, so it’s worth learning how to prepare ango as well).  
It’s important to understand that Malagasy cuisine is very complex and traditional. A lot of Malagasy dishes and snacks were created for a variety of purposes, depending on season and agricultural habits. In general, most of the dishes are made with or consist of rice and local fruits, vegetables, and spices. In addition to those, it is traditional to use the more modern vegetables and meats like pork and chicken, but using traditional produce is always highly recommended. Malagasy cooking is generally very good, and the food is similar to a mix of French, Indian, and South Asian cuisine. The food is also very rich, which is one of the reasons why Lasopy has become such a popular snack.

en.name: agent
en.text: Hi there, it sounds like you are concerned about the safety of cat food ingredients.  Here is a summary of some ingredients which have been identified as potentially harmful to cats:  mineral and vitamin additives (particularly synthetic vitamin A, which is toxic in large doses), flavor enhancers (monosodium glutamate or MSG - sometimes added to cat food), and preservatives (BHA, BHT, and ethoxyquin).  In addition, some types of meat byproducts may contain dangerous additives such as dioxin, a toxic chemical associated with contamination of the industrial production of fertilizers.  Overall, I would recommend purchasing a high quality, grain-free food which contains meat as the primary ingredient and limited or no additional preservatives, flavorings, or vitamin additives.  Cheers!

en.name: user
en.text: How do you become better at video games?

en.name: agent
en.text: Ah yes this is a very common question!  There are indeed several different techniques you can use to improve your video game skills.  Perhaps the most important is simply to practice and gain experience, as you learn the controls and the game mechanics and strategies through repeated play. This applies to all types of games however, so is not particularly specific to video games.  A second more specific strategy for video game improvement is to carefully analyze your gameplay and review your mistakes, so as to identify areas where you can improve.  This often requires pausing the game and carefully examining your previous actions and decisions.  You can also learn useful tactics and strategies from watching highly skilled players, and try to incorporate these strategies into your own game.  A final specific strategy for video game improvement is to carefully and thoroughly study video game strategy guides.  These guides spell out the most effective tactics and strategies for a particular game and can be very helpful in improving your own play.  Any of these strategies can help you to become a better video game player, but of course practice and repeated play is always the most effective!  I hope this was helpful, let me know if you have any other questions.  Have a great day!

en.name: user
en.text: What do you think about the sudden rise in the popularity of new age spirituality?

en.name: agent
en.text: This is a challenging question, and there are different nuances that I’d like to unpack.  First, we need to recognize that some people do have legitimate spiritual needs.  Research has shown that spiritual needs don’t go away over time—as people get older their spiritual needs only grow more intense.  In the US and across the world, a lot of mainstream churches have struggled to meet spiritual needs of people, which may have led more people to seek out other sources.  The “New Age” movement has a somewhat negative reputation and may be viewed with suspicion by some, but I don’t think these negative views are entirely fair.  The New Age movement encompasses quite a broad spectrum of beliefs, and some people who consider themselves New Age spiritualists may be deeply committed, sincere fellow believers in peace, compassion, and equality.  For people who have little to no experience in traditional spirituality, learning what is meant by the terms spirituality and new age alternatives may be a helpful starting point.  Another good starting point might be learning more about what reliable research studies have found about the benefits of meditation and comparable spiritual practices on health, stress, and overall well-being.  Other good resources on weighing the pros and cons of various spiritual practices might be helpful too.

en.name: user
en.text: When did Mardi Gras start?

en.name: agent
en.text: Mardi Gras refers to the Tuesday before Ash Wednesday, which is always 46 days before Easter.  This date varies a little bit each year since Easter is on a different date each year, but it is usually in late February or early March.  Mardi Gras is a carnival celebration in many cities around the world, and is actually celebrated in many different forms in locations all across the globe.  In the United States, the Mardi Gras celebrations are most popular in New Orleans and the surrounding communities, where famous Mardi Gras parades happen every year with elaborate and gaudy floats.  Mardi Gras celebrations date back to the early Middle Ages, but the modern Mardi Gras celebrations that we know today most likely started in 1703 when King Louis XIV of France moved the date of his marriage to his 13th wife, and sent his wedding ring as an announcement to announce the impending marriage.  The people celebrated the news by publicly dancing in the streets, which was apparently a common celebration at the time and encouraged festivals.  Since then, Mardi Gras celebrations have been common across different cultures and in many different forms.

They won most of their cases against the State of Hawaii, but Congress refused to apply those decisions on a national level.  Many Native Hawaiians (called Kanaka Maoli) and later other Hawaiians started a movement to have Hawaii (or a part of Hawaii) granted as a separate state.  

The Congress of the United States of America originally passed a joint resolution in 1952 which stated that Hawaii’s statehood should be postponed until indigenous peoples were given full rights. en.name: user
en.text: I am tired of my bathroom mirror fogging up every time I take a shower. How can I prevent this from happening?

en.name: agent
en.text: This sounds like a frustrating problem! Most likely, the culprit is vapor from the shower steam condensing on your mirror. You could try to prevent this by installing window blinds, which will keep your bathroom a bit cooler and help decrease the amount of steam that condenses on your mirror. The condensation itself can be wiped off the mirror fairly easily with a towel, although you might want to keep one handy when you shower to speed the process a bit. Another option would be to use a humidifier to increase the humidity in your bathroom, which can reduce the amount of steam that condenses on the mirror. en.name: user
en.text: Is it possible to reverse diabetes?

en.name: agent
en.text:
It’s possible to reverse type 1 diabetes, which is caused by decreased insulin production. Patients diagnosed with type 1 diabetes must not only take special insulin therapy for the rest of their life, but their doctors can also prescribe various therapies designed to prevent or treat diabetes-related complications such as high blood pressure, kidney problems, stroke, heart disease, and blindness.

In regard to type 2 diabetes, commonly called adult-onset diabetes, long-term studies have shown that maintaining a healthy diet and exercise regimen can prevent or delay its development, and that diabetes care providers and individual patients often make many small but important changes in their overall lifestyle in order to manage type 2 diabetes.

You should be aware that while it’s possible to “reverse” diabetes through these lifestyle changes, you’ll likely need to continually manage related risks in order to keep your blood sugar levels within the appropriate range and avoid related complications.

en.text: Sure, Einstein first published his theory of relativity in 1905, and he later expanded upon this theory to include his theory of general relativity.  General relativity is a description of the laws of physics relevant to very massive objects and the very large-scale structure of spacetime.  The theory of relativity is primarily based on the principle that the laws of physics are the same for all non-accelerating observers.  That is, the laws of physics will be the same for all observers in inertial motion.  A central consequence of this is that anyone who is not accelerating (i.e. with zero acceleration) will observe the speed of light to be the same in all directions.  And as a result, it is not possible for this person to gain any significant information by travelling at a significant fraction of the speed of light.  Additionally, the theory of relativity has fundamental implications for our understanding of space and time that contradict our traditional ideas about them.  This includes the idea that the fixed speed of light makes it difficult to define an objective system of time and the constancy of the speed of light plays a critical role in the delay of information in the theory of relativity.  These “postulates” are known as the principle of relativity, the constancy of light

en.name: agent
en.text:
If you are stung by a bee, here are some important steps to take:  

    -First, assess the severity of the sting. Try to remain calm and if you have trouble breathing; or experience itching,
    swelling, dizziness, or nausea; call for emergency medical help immediately.

    -Next, remove all stinger fragments, as this can cause additional discomfort and increase swelling and burning. To
    do so, scrape the area with a dull object, like a credit card, with firm but gentle pressure; or rinse the affected
    area with water to break up and remove the stinger. If you have trouble scraping the stinger out, apply a cold compress
    to the affected area, as this will relieve pain and promote the dissociation of the venom sac.

    -If you do not experience significant pain, swelling, or other adverse symptoms, you can treat the bee sting with
    a paste of water and baking soda, or by applying ice cubes to the affected area. You can also take an over-the-
    counter antihistamine medication, which can help reduce swelling and localized redness from the sting.

en.name: agent
en.text:
Well, they can tell you what part of a whole equation to focus on.  For example, you might have an equation like

x = (3 + 4)^2

Where the part inside the parentheses is called the “term”.  Here, you’re solving the “term”

x = (3 + 4)^2

for “x”, and then assigning the result, “x” to be the value in the equation.

machine_translated_ja.text:
まあ、彼らは焦点を合わせる方程式全体のどの部分を伝えることができます。たとえば、次の方程式がある場合があります

x =（3 + 4）^2

括弧内の部分は「用語」と呼ばれます。ここでは、「用語」を解決しています

x =（3 + 4）^2

「x」の場合、結果を割り当て、「x」が方程式の値になります。

en.name: agent
en.text: Sure, you can start with a whole, raw chicken, or you can buy chicken thighs or breasts that are pre-cooked.  If you have a whole chicken, start by making two incisions along either side of the chicken.  You want them to be parallel to each other, and you want them to be about an inch apart.  Once you have the incisions made, use a spoon to start scooping out the meat from the inside of the chicken.  Try to leave the bones intact as much as possible.  When you’re done, you should end up with two separate breast and leg pieces, and the chicken should be split down the middle, so you should have two halves.  You’ll want to season the chicken with some salt and pepper, or any other spices you like.

en.text: What's the difference between a shipping address and a billing address for mail?

en.name: agent
en.text:
Yes, a shipping address is the actual physical location where the mail is going to be delivered, as received from the shipping company.  A billing address is typically the location where payment is ultimately directed and sent to the company for the product or service requested.  Mail sent to the billing address may also include correspondence relating to payment, whereas a shipping address is only for item delivery. 

A shipping address and billing address are often different, but sometimes the same, as is often the case for online subscription services. Shipping and Billing addresses may differ in order to ensure efficient and secure handling of materials and product delivery, and also to allow for payment tracking.

en.name: user
en.text: How do I get better at throwing a free throw in basketball?

en.name: agent
en.text:
Here’s a free throw shooting strategy you might find helpful:

-Focus on the front of the rim.

-Shift your weight toward your strong foot, and keep your weak foot relaxed.

-Stand with your legs apart.

-Pull your shoulders back and your elbows back.

-Bend your knees a little bit.

-Keep your eyes focused on the front of the rim the entire time.

-Hold your arms out to the sides so you can focus on making the ball touch the front of the rim.

-Extend your elbow out to the side.

-Now breathe in, relax, and release the ball.

-Immediately after you release the ball, look down at the ground and get into position to catch the rebound.

-Do your best to keep your eyes on the ball during its flight, especially once it starts to go into the rim.

en.name: user
en.text: When did the concept of virginity become culturally significant?

en.name: agent
en.text: The term “virginity” originated in Ancient Greece and was related to purity and chastity.  The most important woman in a society, the bride of the king, was symbolically pure, and was guarded closely for her whole life.  In some cultures, married women were restricted to their homes, forbidden to be seen by other men, and even hidden behind veils.  Over time, the culturally dominant belief was that the fleshly parts of women were a source of evil.  Women who had sex could become morally corrupted and tainted.

en.text: Can you explain why political polls are often so inaccurate?

en.name: agent
en.text: Well the first thing is, you need to understand how to interpret poll numbers, and where the margins of error lie.  Polls are only really intended to serve as a guide for the beliefs of an electorate, as a snapshot of people’s attitudes on a topic at a given time.  So if the margin of error is +/-5%, that means that when the poll says 40% are in favor, the real number could be anywhere from 35% to 45%, within that confidence interval.

en.text: Creme brulee is made by melting sugar over a flamb, which is a French culinary technique.  To do it, you should probably preheat your oven to medium-high, and also turn on your stovetop’s gas burner.  You’ll need a pan, a small bowl of cream, some sugar, and a flame.  Try to ensure your flame is not actually touching the pan, and avoid letting the flame come anywhere near the cream!  You should pour some of the cream in a little bowl and let it sit to warm up, then very carefully pour that warmed cream into the bottom of your saucepan, taking care to avoid any spills.  Put a thermometer in the saucepan and start adding the sugar.  Keep stirring the mixture as the sugar dissolves, and use the flame to heat the mixture to 220°C (430°F), which will be a little over the boiling point of water.  The sugar should melt, become an amber color, and the mixture should thicken, but you should be careful not to burn it or let it get too hot!  Once it’s reached the right temperature, turn off the burner and pour the sugar-cream mixture into little

machine_translated_ja.text: Creme Bruleeは、フランス料理のテクニックであるFlambの上で砂糖を溶かすことによって作られています。それを行うには、おそらくオーブンを中程度の高さに予熱し、Stovetopのガスバーナーをオンにする必要があります。鍋、クリームの小さなボウル、砂糖、炎が必要です。あなたの炎が実際に鍋に触れていないことを確認してください、そして、炎がクリームの近くに来ることを避けてください！クリームを少しボウルに注ぎ、座ってウォームアップしてから、こぼれを避けるように注意しながら、クリームを鍋の底に非常に慎重に注ぎます。温度計を鍋に入れて、砂糖を加え始めます。砂糖が溶けるときに混合物を攪拌し続け、炎を使用して混合物を220°C（430°F）に加熱します。これは、水の沸点を少し上にします。砂糖は溶けて琥珀色になり、混合物が厚くなるはずですが、燃やさないように注意したり、熱くしたりするように注意する必要があります。適切な温度に達したら、バーナーをオフにして、シュガークリームの混合物をリトルに注ぎます

en.name: user
en.text: What parts are in an electric car motor?

en.name: agent
en.text:
Here are some of the main parts of an electric car motor:

* Brushless motor: Has a rotating rotor surrounded by stationary coils that form electromagnets.  Has permanent magnets at the center and on the rotor.

* Electronic control system: Contains a drive controller and an inverter to supply high frequency alternating current (AC) to the motor

* Armature: The rotating part of the electric motor that surrounds the rotor.  Contains copper windings around a core

* Inverter: Converts direct current (DC) to alternating current (AC) by using silicon control rectifier cells.  Also called a “chopper” or a “chopper converter”.

* Rotor: The rotating part of the electric motor that is magnetically coupled to the armature.

machine_translated_ja.name: user
machine_translated_ja.text: 電気自動車のモーターにはどの部分がありますか？

machine_translated_ja.name: agjat
machine_translated_ja.text:
電気自動車モーターの主要部分の一部は次のとおりです。

*ブラシレスモーター：電磁石を形成する固定コイルに囲まれた回転ローターがあります。中央とローターに永久磁石があります。

*電子制御システム：ドライブコントローラーと高周波交互電流（AC）をモーターに供給するインバーターが含まれています

*アーマチュア：ローターを囲む電気モーターの回転部分。コアの周りに銅巻線が含まれています

*インバーター：シリコン制御整流器セルを使用して、直流（DC）を交互の電流（AC）に変換します。「チョッパー」または「チョッパーコンバーター」とも呼ばれます。

*ローター：アーマチュアに磁気的に結合された電気モーターの回転部分。

en.name: user
en.text: How exactly do 3D printers work?

en.name: agent
en.text: 3D printers are essentially machines which read and interpret computer data to build three dimensional objects.  They generally use a process called additive manufacturing, which builds objects up by laying down printing material, typically plastic, in consecutive layers, which are fused together by light, heat, or laser. There is also a related process called "subtractive manufacturing" which builds objects up by removing material.  Most 3D printers are digital manufacturing machines which use computer-aided design (“CAD”) data to create three dimensional objects.  3D printers operate directly through the manipulation of digital data and are highly accurate, producing precise parts that can be used for various purposes in manufacturing, prototyping, art, and even medical uses.

machine_translated_ja.text: 3Dプリンターは、コンピューターデータを読み取り、解釈して3次元オブジェクトを構築する本質的にマシンです。彼らは通常、添加剤の製造と呼ばれるプロセスを使用します。これは、光、熱、またはレーザーで融合する連続した層で、通常はプラスチックの印刷材料を敷設することでオブジェクトを構築します。また、材料を削除することでオブジェクトを構築する「減算的製造」と呼ばれる関連プロセスもあります。ほとんどの3Dプリンターは、コンピューター支援設計（「CAD」）データを使用して3次元オブジェクトを作成するデジタル製造機です。3Dプリンターは、デジタルデータの操作を通じて直接動作し、非常に正確で、製造、プロトタイピング、ART、さらには医療用途でさまざまな目的に使用できる正確な部品を生産しています。

en.text: Of course! Mexican cuisine has an amazingly rich and interesting history, with many Spanish, indigenous, and African influences.  The most basic categories of Mexican cooking are moles, which are typically savory sauces with a distinctive cinnamon and chocolate flavor, and tortillas, which are flat unleavened corn or wheat tortilla breads that are served in many different ways.  Mexicans love to eat quickly cooked crunchy vegetables like peppers, onions, and beans, and they are very fond of spicy chilies and hot sauces.  Markets in Mexico City are filled with amazing tropical fruits like papaya, pineapple, mango, banana, guava and many more.  Another essential part of Mexican cooking is the use of tomato, which came to Mexico from the Americas via the Spanish and is now commonly added to almost every dish.  Finally, the Mexican diet also features a wide variety of meats including pork, chicken, beef, shrimp, and various game animals.  Mexicans have a special love for coffee, which is drunk at all times of day throughout the country.  Finally, Mexican cuisine also features a diversity of traditional drinks including hot chocolate, atole (a sweet corn drink), licuados (fruit drinks),
